page.title: 01Goonhilly Downs
page.content: Viewed from the roads, this is a high windy plateau with gorse heaths and purple moor grass. The soil in places very thin, is weatherthed gabro over yellow clay and gabbro and serpentine rock. There are disused quarries, gravel pits and turf drying circles. Where cultivated it grows good grass. Dredge corn (oats and barley) and swedes. It supports over 400 fresian milking cows with followers, a welsh black pedigree beef herd , 200 more beek and several hundred sheep, pigs and horses. There are seven main farm settlements land has been purchased by the Nature Conservancy Council who,are trying methods of management to preserve the natural vegetation on a long term basis. Rosuic is re-planting Hardwoods and Connifers.
